summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons 24-hour death report for inmate Jeffery Edward Epstein, documenting his death by alleged suicide on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It details the timeline of events from his placement on suicide watch in July to the discovery of his body and subsequent medical response.

persons.name: Jeffery Edward Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, whose death by alleged suicide is the subject of the report.

persons.name: BOP52781
persons.context: The Bureau of Prisons staff member who submitted the death notification.

events.title: Epstein placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Jeffery Epstein was placed on Suicide Watch for 31 hours and 5 minutes due to an abrasion on his neck.

events.title: Epstein taken off Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was removed from Suicide Watch and placed on Psychological Observation.

events.title: Epstein placed in Special Housing Unit
events.description: Epstein was removed from Psychological Observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a cellmate.

events.title: Psychology Services evaluation
events.description: Epstein was seen by Psychology Services and denied any suicidal ideation, intention, or plan.

events.title: Death of Jeffery Epstein
events.description: Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at 6:33 a.m. CPR and emergency medical procedures were initiated. He was transported to New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital and pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007)
New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital
keyFacts: Jeffery Edward Epstein died on August 10, 2019, at 7:36 a.m. at New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital after being found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The preliminary cause of death is listed as 'Alleged Suicide' and an autopsy was ordered.
Epstein had been placed on Suicide Watch on July 23, 2019, due to an abrasion on his neck, but was removed less than two days later and placed on Psychological Observation.
On August 8, 2019, just two days before his death, Epstein was evaluated by Psychology Services and denied any suicidal thoughts, intention, or plan.
At the time of his death, Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a cellmate.
